channel.title: PI MEMORY LEAK--FIX? Will Rep++
channel.description:
Hi, I know there is a PI memory leak, I was wondering if you could please give me the fix. I will rep++ if you give me correct fix. Right now my memory usage is 200,000 K with 0 players online.
That is outrageous, please help me with fix, will rep++

item.title: PI MEMORY LEAK--FIX? Will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @brandonscarinfo brandonscarinfo
item.description:
@brandonscarinfo wrote:

[quote=“JaydenD12, post:24, topic:378876”][quote author=brandonscarinfo link=topic=474736.msg3471223#msg3471223 date=1295305586]
Hi, I know there is a PI memory leak, I was wondering if you could please give me the fix. I will rep++ if you give me correct fix. Right now my memory usage is 200,000 K with 0 players online.

That is outrageous, please help me with fix, will rep++
[/quote]

If you’re using dspk the memory leak is in the npc class. It has to do with the clipped npc following, just remove it and it should be fine…

I suggest not using that source though, not only does the server have major memory leaks so does the client. (420k+ while the player is logged in, the average client uses about 180k. Go figure.)

The programmer of dspk is retarded, nobody should use that poorly programmed piece of shit.

Also, get a better profiler. VisualVM sucks. Get JProfiler.[/quote]

jayden!! if you wer’ent 200 rep I would give u all my rep for the rest of my life!!! thank you soo much@!!! I am going to go hunt down the npc clipping now 0.0

thanks bro

Ill post results

Read full topic

item.title: PI MEMORY LEAK--FIX? Will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

[quote=“brandonscarinfo, post:1, topic:378876”]Hi, I know there is a PI memory leak, I was wondering if you could please give me the fix. I will rep++ if you give me correct fix. Right now my memory usage is 200,000 K with 0 players online.

That is outrageous, please help me with fix, will rep++[/quote]

If you’re using dspk the memory leak is in the npc class. It has to do with the clipped npc following, just remove it and it should be fine…

I suggest not using that source though, not only does the server have major memory leaks so does the client. (420k+ while the player is logged in, the average client uses about 180k. Go figure.)

The programmer of dspk is retarded, nobody should use that poorly programmed piece of shit.

Also, get a better profiler. VisualVM sucks. Get JProfiler.

Read full topic

If you look @ the picture in one of my replies it says the bytes[] is the memory hog, if anyone could show me or tell me what exactly the bytes[] is so I can attempt to fix I would be very grateful

item.title: PI MEMORY LEAK--FIX? Will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“brandonscarinfo, post:18, topic:378876”]I swear to god I bought Java for Dummies, it’s being shipped atm, should be here day after tomorrow.

But can someone please help me?[/quote][quote=“brandonscarinfo, post:18, topic:378876”]I swear to god I bought Java for Dummies, it’s being shipped atm, should be here day after tomorrow.

But can someone please help me?[/quote]

Java for dummies will only help you a little bit. Try looking for online tutorials or even video tutorials. Try looking into how game engines are built in JAVA or how a game is built in JAVA in general. They give INCREDIBLE insight on how to program and will (in the end) help you locate the problem itself.

++ Other people have told you what and where you need to look and they have fixed this problem themselves.

Read full topic

item.title: PI MEMORY LEAK--FIX? Will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“brandonscarinfo, post:16, topic:378876”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=474736.msg3471762#msg3471762 date=1295343929]
1)Write your own framework
2)Hope for no memory leaks
3)Realize you suck at programming

Please for the love of god, try and learn some JAVA before attempting to program a private server. It’ll only help you in the long run.
[/quote]

Im not attempting to program… here can someone tell me how I can isolate this and fix?

[/quote]

If you have a source and you have changed code in some form, you are attempting to program.

It would be much easier for you to understand HOW to fix it if you just sat down and learned JAVA.

Read full topic

item.title: PI MEMORY LEAK--FIX? Will Rep++
item.dc:creator: @brandonscarinfo brandonscarinfo
item.description:
@brandonscarinfo wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:13, topic:378876”][quote author=brandonscarinfo link=topic=474736.msg3471593#msg3471593 date=1295325597]
can anyone tell me exactly what to fix? PLEASE?
[/quote]

What Scape-Java said should be more then enough information for you to find the leak… Also, I just did a search my self and found a few threads that tell me how to fix the memory leaks, it was very easy, I just typed in Project Insanity memory leaks. And again we will not spoon feed you, if you cannot help your self first don’t ask.[/quote]

I searched, I tried the cougar thing and it didnt work. Scape-Java tried helping but determined my copy of grahams event manager was faulty. I checked it to the event manager of runeverfix, sagi x evolution and sagi x evolution 2, and they are exactly the same.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Evil_:

I’ll give you a hint, if you have memory leaks in java, you’re one horribad programmer.

This, also fix the memory leak in Grahams event manager, it’s a missing switch statement.

item.description:
@brandonscarinfo wrote:

Evil_:

I’ll give you a hint, if you have memory leaks in java, you’re one horribad programmer.

I am very new to RSPS’s in general. So what I did was comment out EventHandler.initialize(); in the server.java
